title: Philippines has 813 new doctors; Perpetual tops exam

organizations.name: university of the east-ramon magsaysay memorial medical center
eastern university nicanor reyes medical foundation
southwestern university-matias aznar memorial college of medicine

text:
Philippines has 813 new doctors; Perpetual tops exam By Mayen Jaymalin   
MANILA, Philippines - University of Perpetual Help System graduate Karl Emmanuel Mercader topped the 813 passers of this year’s licensure examination for physicians, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced yesterday. 
A total of 1,317 graduates took the examination held in the cities of Manila, Baguio, Cebu and Zamboanga cities on March 5 to 6 and March 12 to 13. The results were released three days after the last day of examination. 
PRC said Mercader obtained a grade of 88.58 percent and was followed by Our Lady of Fatima University graduate Alvin Lester Villas with 87.17 percent. 
In third place was University of the East-Ramon Magsaysay Memorial Medical Center graduate Nigel Gerome Cunanan, who obtained a grade of 87.08 percent. 
Southwestern University-Matias Aznar Memorial College of Medicine Maude Tabigue landed in fourth place with a score of 87 percent while University of the Philippines’ Dianne Katherine Salazar-Paras followed with a grade of 86.75 percent. 
Another UP graduate – John Vincent Severino – was sixth with a grade of 86.58 percent.   
University of Santo Tomas graduate Kevin Arao and Our Lady of Fatima graduate Mina Liza Carino tied in seventh spot with a score of 86.17 percent. 
With a grade of 86.08 percent, St. Luke’s College of Medicine graduate Clint Christian Garbanzos placed eighth, followed by another Our Lady of Fatima graduate Aizel Jane Lim, who got a score of 86 percent. 
Central Philippine University graduate Dominique Ariel Tomampos completed the top 10 list with a grade of 85.92 percent. 
Far Eastern University Nicanor Reyes Medical Foundation ranked first in the list of top performing schools in the examination. 
FEU posted 88.20 percent passing score with 157 out of 178 examinees from the school passing the exam. 
Visit philstar.com for complete list of medical board passers.
